name: Excuse me!
notes:
Excuse me.

这是常用于表示道歉的客套话，相当于汉语中“劳驾”、”对不起”。这个短语常用于与陌生人搭话、打断别人的说话或从别人身边挤过。在课文中，男士为了吸引女士的注意力而用了这个表示客套的短语。它也可用在下列场合：向陌生人问路、借用他人的电话或在宴席或会议中途要离开一会等等

Yes?

这里的Yes？应用升调朗读，意思是：’什么事？’。Yes？以升调表示某种不肯定或询问之意，也含有请对方说下去的意思。

Pardon?

全句为 I beg your pardon 或 Pardon me. 意思是请求对方把刚刚讲过的话重复一遍。当我们没有听清或没理解对方的话并希望对方能重复一遍时，就可以使用这一表达方式。

name: Sorry, Sir.
course: Customer: My coat and my umbrella please.
Boss: Here's your umbrella and your coat.
Customer: This is not my umbrella.
translation: 请把我的大衣和伞拿给我。
这是我（寄存东西）的牌子。
notes:
My coat and my umbrella please.

这是一个省略形式的祈使句，完整的句子应为：Give me my coat and my umbrella, please. 口语中，在语境明确的情况下通常可省略动词和间接宾语，如：（Show me your）Ticket, please. （Show me your）Passport, please.））

Here's your umbrella and your coat.

Here's 是 Here is 的缩写形式，类似的还有 He's（He is），It's（It is）等。缩写形式和非缩写形式在英语的书面用语和口语中均有，但非缩写形式常用于比较正式的场合。
Here's... 是一种习惯用法，句中采用了倒装句式，即系动词提到了主语之前。又如 Here is my ticket 这句话用正常的语序时为 My ticket is here。

Sorry = I'm sorry.

这是口语中的缩写形式，用于社交场合，向他人表示歉意或某种程度的遗憾。
Sorry 和 Excuse me 虽在汉语中都可作‘对不起’讲，但 Sorry 常用于对自己所犯过失表示道歉，而 Excuse me 则多为表示轻微歉意的客套话。

Sir

先生。这是英美人对不相识的男子、年长者、或上级的尊称。

Is this it?

本句中的 it 是指 your umbrella。由于前面提到了，后面就用代词it来代替，以免重复。

name: Nice to Meet You.
course: Mr.Blake: This is Miss Sophie Dupont.
Mr.Blake: Sophie is a new student. She is French.
Mr.Blake: Sophie, this is Hans. He is German.
Mr.Blake: And this is Naoko. She's Japanese.
Mr.Blake: And this is Chang-woo. He's Korean.
Mr.Blake: And this is Luming. He is Chinese.
Mr.Blake: And this is Xiaohui. She's Chinese, too.
translation: 这位是索菲亚·杜邦小姐。
索菲亚是新来的学生。她是法国人。
索菲亚，这位是汉斯。他是德国人。
这位是直子。她是日本人。
这位是昌宇。他是韩国人。
这位是鲁明。他是中国人。
这位是晓慧。她也是中国人。
notes:
Good morning.

早上好。英语中常见的问候用语。对此问候的回应一般也是Good morning。类似的：Good afternoon、Good evening。

This is Miss Sophie Dupont.

This is + 人名 是将某人介绍给他人的句式。

Mr. Blake / Miss Sophie Dupont

英语国家中人的姓名通常由3部分组成，即：名 + 中间名 + 姓。在一般情况下，不用中间名。
在熟悉的人中间，以名相称，而在正式的场合中用 Mr.(先生)、Mrs.(太太)、Miss(小姐) 或 Ms.(女士)这些称呼再加上姓。
Mr. 用于男士的姓之前，不能单独使用，如课文中的 Mr.Blake；而 sir 一般单独使用，是对长者、上司或男顾客的尊称，如：Sorry,sir.
Miss 一般用于指未婚女子，不过有时在不知道对方是否已婚时也可使用。

Nice to meet you.

用于初次与同学、朋友见面等非正式场合。正式的场合常用 How do you do? 这是一句问候语，并非问话。

国籍与国家名称有别

请不要将国家名称和与其对应的国籍搞混。课文中的French、German、Japanese、Korean以及Chinese都是表示国籍的词。句中表示中国国籍的词应为Chinese而不是China。

name: Are You a Teacher?
course: Robert: I am a new student. My name's Robert.
Sophie: Nice to meet you. My name's Sophie.
Sophie: Yes, I am. Are you French too?
translation: 我是新来的学生。我的名字叫罗伯特。
很高兴见到你。我的名字叫索菲亚。
是的，我是法国人。你也是法国人吗？
notes:
My name's = My name is

这是自我介绍时通常使用的句型：My name is...（后面加上自己的姓名）。有时也用 I'm... 这一句型。

Are you French, too?

在英语中，too 和 either 两个词都表示“也”的意思，然而 too 仅用于肯定句中，either 则限于用在否定句中。too 和 either一般都放在句末，且前面通常用逗号隔开。

What nationality are you?

用来询问对方国籍。也可以问 Where are you from? 或 Where do you come form?

What's your job?

What's = What is。询问对方从事何种职业时还可以说：What do you do？

name: How Are You Today?
course: Helen: I'm very well, thank you. And you?
Steven: She's very well, too, Helen.
Steven: Goodbye, Helen. Nice to see you.
Helen: Nice to see you, too, Steven. Goodbye.
translation: 再见，海伦。见到你很高兴。
我见到你也很高兴，史蒂文。再见。
notes:
How are you today?

这是朋友或相识的人之间见面时问对方身体状况的寒暄话，一般回答语：Fine,thank you. I'm fine,thank you. I'm very well, thank you.
如问及对方的先生或太太的情况，可以说 How is Tony? 或 How's Emma? 等。相应的回答可以是 He's fine,thanks 或 She's very well,thank you等。

And you?

是 And how are you？的简略说法。在回答对方问候健康的话之后反问时用。

Nice to see you.

是 It's nice to see you. 的简略说法。这一句也是见面时的客气话，一般回答是：Nice to see you, too. 也可以说：Nice to meet you.

name: Is This Your Shirt?
course: Sir: Is this your shirt, Dave?
Dave: No. Sir. It's not my shirt.
Dave: This is my shirt. My shirt's blue.
translation: 不，先生。这不是我的衬衫。
这是我的衬衫。我的衬衫是蓝色的。
notes:
Whose shirt is that?

这是特殊疑问句。读时用降调。疑问代词 Whose 在本句中作定语，修饰 shirt。

Is this shirt Tim's?

Tim's 是 Tim 的所有格形式，为避免重复，Tim's 后面可以省去 shirt。
例：It isn't my pen, it's Frank's. 这不是我的钢笔，是弗兰克的。

Here you are

是给对方东西时的习惯用语。递给对方东西或对方在找某物而你指出该物在什么地方时，往往用这种方式。也可以说：Here it is (指单数的物)或Here they are (指复数的物)。句中的are和is一般应重读。

非省略形式和省略形式之间的关系

it is not = it isn't = it's not

name: A New Dress.
course: A: What color's your new dress?
B: It's green. Come upstairs and see it.
A: That is a lovely hat!
translation: 你的新连衣裙是什么颜色的？
是绿色的。到楼上来看看吧。
notes:
Come upstairs and see it.

句中的 and 不当 “和” 讲，而是表示目的，例：Come and see me. 来见我。
❌在英语中不能用 Come upstairs to see it.

It's the same color.

same 通常与定冠词 the 连用，表示 同一的、相同的。例如：Two boys of the same age. We live the same city.

That is a lovely hat!

真是一顶可爱的帽子！句末用的是惊叹号，表现出较强的感情色彩。句中的 is 用斜体，是为了强调，应重读。

name: Your Passports, Please.
course: #: No, we are not. We are Danish.
Customs: Are your friends Danish, too?
#: No, they aren't. They are Norwegian.
Customs: Are your friends tourists too?
translation: 不，我们不死瑞典人。我们是丹麦人。
你们的朋友也是丹麦人吗？
不，他们不是丹麦人。他们是挪威人。
你们的朋友也是来旅游的吗？
notes:
可数名词的复数形式

  • 可数名词的复数形式一般是在单数名词后面加上 -s，如课文中的 fiend-friends /frendz/；tourist-tourists /'tʊərsts/；case-cases /keɪsɪz/。请注意 -s 的不同发音。
  • 如果名词是以 -s 结尾的，变成复数时要加 -es 、如 dress-dresses 。
  • 表示复数的 -s 或 -es 一般遵循以下发音规则:
    1. 如果名词词尾的发音是一个清辅音（/s/、/ʃ/、/tʃ/除外。-s 发 /s/ 的音，如：books /bʊks/ 、suits /su:ts/。
    2. 如果名词词尾的发音是一个浊辅音 (/z/、/ʒ/、/dʒ/除外) 或元音，-s 发 /z/ 的音，如：ties /taɪz/、dogs /dɒgz/
    3. 如果名词词尾的发音是 /s/、 /z/、/ʃ/、/ʒ/、/tʃ/ 或 /dʒ/，-s 发 /ɪz/ 的音，如：dresses /dresɪz/、blouses /'blaʊziz/

name: How do you do.
course: Jackson: Come and meet our employees, Mr.Richards.
Jackson: This is Nicola Grey, and this is Claire Taylor.
Richards: Those women are very hard-working.
Jackson: This is Michael Baker, and this is Jeremy Short.
Jackson: They're sales reps. They're very lazy.
Richards: Who is this young man?
Jackson: This is Jim. He's our office assistant.
translation: 来见见我们的雇员，理查德先生。
这位是尼古丁·格雷，这位是克莱尔·泰勒。
这位是迈克尔·贝克，这位是杰里米·肖特。
他们是推销员。他们非常懒。
他是吉姆。是我们的办公室助理。
notes:
How do you do?

您好（用于第一次见面时，正式）。一般用同样的话来回答。联想：Nice to meet you.

sales reps

sales representatives 的缩写形式，常用于口语。

office assistant

指办公室干杂务的工作人员。

可数名词的复数形式（2）

如果名词单数词尾为 -f 或 -fe （读作 /f/），则其复数一律变为 -ves （读作 /vz/）。如： housewife -> housewives。
英语中有一些名词的复数形式是不规则的，如：man 与 woman 的复数形式分别为 men 和 women。此外还可用man 和 woman等来区别阳性和阴性：以man结尾的一些复合名词指男性，如：milkman-milkmen，policeman-policemen；一些以-women结尾的名词指女性，如：postwoman-postwomen，policewoman-policewomen。

name: Tired and Thirsty.
course: Mother: Are you all right now?
Mother: Look! There's an ice-cream man.
Mother: Are you all right now?

name: Which Book?
course: Man: Give me a book please, Jane.
Man: No, not that one. The red one.
translation: 不，不是那本。是那本红色的。
notes:
Give me a book, please.

这是祈使句，省略了主语 you。

This one?

句中的 one 是不定代词，表示 book。 复数形式是 ones。

name: Which Glasses?
course: Man: Give me some glasses please, Jane.
Man: No, not those. The ones on the self.
translation: 请拿给我几只玻璃杯，简。
不，不是那几只。是架子上的那几只。
notes:
Give me some glasses, please.

在 Give me some glasses 中,动间 give 后面有两个宾语，即直接宾语 some glasses 和间接宾语 me。人称代词作宾语时要用人称代词的宾格，如：me(I 的宾格)，us(we 的宾格)，you(you 的宾格)，him(he 的宾格)，her(she 的宾格)，them(they 的宾格)和it(it 的宾格)。

No, not those.

句中 those 是指 those glasses

The ones on the self.

省略句，句中的 ones 代表 glasses

name: Mrs.Smith's Kitchen.
course: There is a refrigerator in the kitchen.
There is an electric cooker in the kitchen.
There is a table in the middle of the room.
There is a bottle on the table.
There is a cup on the table, too.
translation: 史密斯夫人的厨房很小。

name: Mrs.Smith's Living Room.
course: Mrs. Smith's living room is large.
There is a television in the room.
The television is near the window.
There are some magazines on the television.
There is a table in the room.
There are some newspapers on the table.
There are some armchairs in the room.
The armchairs are near the table.
There is a stereo in the room.
The stereo is near the door.
There are some books on the stereo.
There are some pictures in the room.
The pictures are on the wall.
translation: 史密斯夫人的客厅很大。
电视机上放着几本杂志。
客厅里有台立体声音响。

name: Come In, Amy.
course: AMY: What must I do, Mrs. Jones?
MRS.JONES: Open the window and air the room.
MRS.JONES: Then put these clothes in the wardrobe.
translation: 琼斯夫人：这卧室太不整洁了。
艾米：我应该做些什么呢，琼斯夫人？
琼斯夫人：打开窗子，给房间通通风。
琼斯夫人：然后把这些衣服放进衣橱里去。
琼斯夫人：再把床整理一下。
琼斯夫人：掉梳妆台上的灰尘。

name: Where's Sally?
course: JACK: She's in the garden, Jean.
JACK: She's sitting under the tree.
JEAN: Is Tim in the garden, too?
JACK: Yes, he is. He's climbing the tree.
JEAN: I beg your pardon? Who's climbing the tree?
JACK: The dog's in the garden, too.
JACK: too. It's running across the grass.
JACK: It's running after a cat.
translation: 杰克：她正在树荫下坐着。
杰克：是的，他也在花园里。他正在爬树。
杰克：狗也在花园里。它正在草地上跑，在追一只猫。

name: A Fine Day.
course: It is a fine day today.
There are some clouds in the sky,
They are walking over the bridge
There are some boats on the river.
Mr.Jones and his wife are looking at them
Sally is looking at a big ship
The ship is going under the bridge
Tim is looking at an aeroplane
The aeroplane is flying over the river
translation: 天空中飘着几朵云，但阳光灿烂。
琼斯先生同他的家人在一起。
琼斯先生和他的妻子正在看这些船。
莎莉正在观看一艘大船。

name: Our Village.
course: This is a photograph of our village.
Our village is in a valley.
The village is on a river.
Here is another photograph of the village.
My wife and I are walking
along the banks of the river.
There is a boy in the water.
He is swimming across the river.
The park is on the right.
Some children are coming out of the building.
Some of them are going into the park.
translation: 这是我们村庄的一张照片。
我们的村庄坐落在一个山谷之中。
这是我们村庄的另一张照片。
我和妻子正沿河岸走着。
一些孩子正从楼里出来。
他们中有几个正走进公园。

name: Making a Bookcase.
course: GEORGE: Give me that hammer please, Dan.
GEORGE: No, not that one. The big one.
DAN: What are you going to do now, George?
GEORGE: I'm going to paint it.
DAN: What color are you going to paint it?
GEORGE: I'm going to paint it pink.
GEORGE: This bookcase isn't for me.
GEORGE: It's for my daughter, Susan.
translation: 丹：你干得真辛苦，乔治。你在干什么呢？
乔治：请把那把锤子拿给我，丹。
乔治：不，不是那把。是那把大的。
丹：你现在打算干什么，乔治？
乔治：我打算把它漆一下。
丹：你打算把它漆成什么颜色？
乔治：这个书架不是为我做的
乔治：是为我的女儿苏珊做的
乔治：粉红色是她最喜欢的颜色。

name: Don't Drop it.
course: SAM: What are you going to do with that vase, Penny?
PENNY: I''m going to put it on this table, Sam.
SAM: Don''t do that. Give it to me.
PENNY: What are you going to do with it?
SAM: I''m going to put it here, in front of the window.
PENNY: Be careful! Don''t drop it!
PENNY: Don''t put it there, Sam. Put it here, on this shelf.
SAM: There we are! It''s a lovely vase.
PENNY: Those flowers are lovely, too.
translation: 萨姆：你打算如何处理那花瓶？
彭妮：我打算把它放在这张桌子上，萨姆。
萨姆：不要放在那儿，把它给我。
萨姆：我准备把它放在这儿，放在窗前。
彭妮：别放在那儿，萨姆，放在这儿，这个架子上。
萨姆：这是只漂亮的花瓶。
彭妮：那些花也很漂亮啊。
